2. use strong passwords: passwords are the first line of defense against hackers. ensure that your password is long, complex, and difficult to guess. also, change your passwords regularly. 
3. control who can see your content: social media platforms have different privacy settings that allow you to control who can see your content. make sure you only share content with people you trust. 
4. limit the number of apps that access your data: social media platforms often ask permission for third-party apps to access your data. be careful while granting permissions and limit the number of apps that have access to your data. 
5. keep an eye on your online presence: your social media activity can be seen by anyone, including potential employers or people you don't want to see it. therefore, ensure that your content is appropriate and doesn't give away too much personal information.
